item.title: Automated Reporting on Lacking Rainfall in Germany
item.dc:creator: Yannik
item.description: Climate change causes severe disturbances in what we used to call a more or less stable climate. Data journalists are, thus, increasingly focusing on quantifying the effects of the climate crisis. This is an example on how to do so.

item.title: Covid-19 - See German shopping streets emptying
item.dc:creator: Yannik
item.description: The coronavirus is halting public live. Looking at pedestrian data shows how persistently people stay away from German city centres and give an estimate of the situation is for shops in city centres.

item.title: Scraping Spiegel articles using {newsanchor}
item.dc:creator: Yannik
item.description: One convenient use of **{newsanchor}** is to use it to scrape the articles' content. Our package is of great help because it provides you with the corresponding URLs.

item.title: Automatically filling a SQLite database using AWS and RStudio Server
item.dc:creator: Yannik
item.description: The R script used is a simple parser. To automate it, set up a SQLite database on AWS. The script parses a JSON file and writes it into the database using SQL.

item.title: Introducing the R {newsanchor} package
item.dc:creator: Yannik
item.description: At CorrelAid, we developed a tool for communication scientists, journalists and data scientists alike. It conveniently helps you to access breaking news and articles from over 30,000 news sources and blogs using newsapi.org.

item.title: Voting Behaviour in the 2014 Scottish Independence Referendum
item.dc:creator: Yannik
item.description: I investigated the voting behaviour of the Scottish electorate in the 2014 Scottish independence referendum. More precisely, I was the first attempting to explain voting behaviour in the referendum based on a multivariate quantitative approach.
